sub_title: Human Centered Design director at Proportion Global
summary:
The new normal? Living in a world where the economy is about offering 'meaningful' products and services designed for improving people's quality of life. That is the new normal I envision.  
  
We work hard to make that happen. ProPortion offers human-centered design and venture building support to NGOs, social businesses and corporates who aim to impact low-income communities. We support them in innovating new services, products and business models and build social impact ventures. 

Our methodology combines human-centered design and lean start-up. A key success is to have great empathy for the people you want to design a solution for. Through qualitative research, we gain a deep understanding of people's needs, aspirations and constraints to generate rich insights. We turn those insights into ideas, in co-creation with the customer segments and other system actors. We prototype the most promising ideas to get user feedback as soon as possible, to learn and pivot, till we get it right. This includes validation of revenue models, marketing and pricing, in order to create viable innovations. 

Over the last 11 years, we have enriched our skills & knowledge base through getting our hands dirty in the field in co-creating new innovations with and for low-income communities in South Asia, Africa and South America. We are passionate and highly motivated to share our experience with others to speed up the mainstreaming of such social entrepreneurial industry & venture building. For that reason, we have launched the Proportion Academy whereby local instructors around the world train and coach aspiring entrepreneurs in building ventures.

projects.title: LegBank Colombia
projects.description:
Colombia has the highest victim rate of landmines in the world. It causes, together with diabetes and traffic accidents, many amputees. When ProPortion found out there are many amputees in Colombia that do not have access to a qualitative prosthesis, we decided to further research the situation.

In the past 5 months we went for 9 weeks to Colombia with a group of young talented designers from TU Delft. We interviewed prosthesis makers, healthcare insurance companies and other stakeholders in the Colombian health care system. We learned the current way of prosthesis making in Colombia is time-consuming and requires a lot of knowledge and skills. The experienced and certified prosthetic centres are mainly located in big cities, therefore rural amputees need to travel a lot. During this time they cannot take care of their families, nor work, creating all sorts of social, financial and mental problems. Since prostheses are expensive, and people not always have effective insurance companies, so a part of the low-income amputees do not get a prosthesis at all. 

During our research, we found an exciting new way to create prosthetic sockets invented by the Strathclyde University (UK) that makes it possible to make qualitative lower limb prosthetic socket prosthesis in a short amount of time for a low price. It is relatively easy to teach and implement, especially in low income countries where human resources are often scarce and the demand is high.

We aim to deliver within the coming 2 years a fully working product in order to create a prosthesic socket that can be combined with other low-cost components in order to have a qualitative, affordable prosthesis; and a business plan with a value proposition, a marketing strategy and the roadmap to create impact at scale. In order to restore the mobility and independence of amputees, so that they can lead a mobile and dignified life. 

If you know people that could be interested in this project, please let me know!

projects.title: Sustainable Match
projects.description:
Sustainable Match is an initiative of six complementary parties: 
MVO Nederland, Agri-ProFocus, Oxfam Novib, People Connector, ProPortion and BBO.

We believe that SMEs can be both profitable as well as having a social impact, when matched to the right local partners in the right way. At the same time we provide an answer to the ongoing questions on how to improve private sector development instruments and policies, how to better involve SMEs in emerging markets in developing countries to contribute to economic development and contribute to poverty reduction.

Two matchmaking missions to Uganda and Bangladesh will be organized in spring 2013 in which 10 Dutch and 10 local SMEs/NGOs can participate.

profile_positions.description: Proportion Global is the most decentralised human-centered design agency in the world, enabling our clients to access HCD professionals across Africa, Latin America and South Asia. Proportion Global offers design support to start-ups, NGOs and companies who aim at creating positive impact through meaningful products and services.
profile_positions.title: Executive Director

profile_positions.description:
ProPortion Foundation's mission is to realise social businesses, at the Base-of-Pyramid, together. 
We are currently incubating 3 social enterprises:
1. Sujol:  a good water business in Bangladesh
2. Vijana Reloaded: Agripreneurship Training Institute for young adults in rural Kenia
3. Legbank: a business making leg-prosthesis affordable & accessible for people in rural Colombia

As director and senior business developer, I am end-responsible for the incubation trajectories of ProPortion Foundation.
profile_positions.title: Director

company.name: Royal Society for the encouragement of Arts, Manufactures and Commerce (The RSA)

profile_positions.company: The RSA (The royal society for arts, manufactures and commerce)
profile_positions.description:
Founded in 1754, the RSA (Royal Society for the encouragement of Arts, Manufactures and Commerce) has a wealth of notable achievements and Fellows in its 260-year history. 

The RSA is an enlightenment organisation committed to finding innovative practical solutions to today’s social challenges. Through its ideas, research it seeks to understand and enhance human capability so we can close the gap between today’s reality and people’s hopes for a better world.

In the light of new challenges and opportunities for the human race our purpose is to develop and promote new ways of thinking about human fulfillment and social progress which speaks directly to our strap-line - 21st century enlightenment.

(Charles Dickens, Benjamin Franklin, Karl Marx, Stephen Hawking and Tim Berners-Lee are some of the notable past and present members)
profile_positions.title: Fellow

profile_positions.description:
Reggs' core business ranges from brand strategy to designing industrial products, packaging, corporate identities and motion. 

Personally I am active in social business development through design strategy, which means co-creating new concepts for product-service systems that positively contibute to people, planet and profit. 

How can you create business value by integrating CSR with your corporate strategy? 

In this process, we make use of the Cradle to Cradle philosophy that starts at defining the intentions to become 100% good, in stead of goal to become 0% bad. 

Reggs has 10 Cradle to Cradle design consultants, accredited by Michael Braungart / EPEA.
profile_positions.title: Sustainable Business Development

profile_positions.description:
- Project & team leader of the development of a high-tech innovation; a low-power wireless sensor network technology. Responsible for strategy, partnering, technical and commerical project leading. The first application for effective water management is launched: www.sensiplant.com. 
- New business development manager Europe. Responsible for acquisition of new contract research and consultancy projects for Telecom Operators in Europe. 
- Account manager of first international client: responsible for turning new European client into the first international strategic client of TNO ICT. 
- Business consultant: team member of two major European consultancy projects ‘Next Generation Networks strategies amongst European telco’s’ and ‘xDSL performance optimalisation’.
